explains: v. 感到悲痛；（因某人的去世而）悲伤；（使）悲伤（grieve 的现在分词）

sentences.en: Tom came up to the fence and leaned on it, grieving, and hoping she would tarry yet awhile longer.
sentences.cn: 汤姆走到栅栏前，倚在栅栏上，悲痛欲绝，希望她再多呆一会儿。

sentences.en: McWhorter acknowledges that formal language is not strictly necessary, and proposes no radical education reforms—he is really grieving over the loss of something beautiful more than useful.
sentences.cn: McWhorter 承认正式的语言并不是绝对必要的，也没有提出任何激进的教育改革——他实际上是在为失去一些美丽但相对不实用的东西而悲伤。

sentences.en: He's grieving over his dead wife and son.
sentences.cn: 他因丧妻失子而悲痛不已。
